headline: Ameriprise Financial (NYSE:AMP) Announces US$4.5 Billion Buyback and 8% Dividend Increase
summary: Ameriprise Financial (NYSE:AMP) recently announced a decrease in net income and an increase in revenue, along with an 8% dividend increase and a substantial share repurchase program. These events coincided with a week when the broader market, including the S&P 500, saw substantial gains of 2.3% driven by robust earnings reports and optimism over potential changes in tariff policies. Ameriprise's share price rose by 1.9%. While the company's news could have supported its performance, the...

headline: Ameriprise Financial Reports Mixed Results. The Stock Rises Slightly.
summary: Ameriprise said unadjusted net income fell 41% year over year and that its asset-management unit had net outflows of $18.3 billion.

headline: Ameriprise Financial's quarterly profit rises on wealth management strength
summary: Ameriprise Financial reported an 8% rise in first-quarter profit on Thursday, buoyed by the strength in its wealth management business. With more baby boomers transitioning into retirement and younger people accumulating wealth, the demand for financial advice has risen. Minneapolis, Minnesota-based Ameriprise's adjusted operating revenue from its advice and wealth management arm rose 9% to $2.78 billion in the quarter ended March 31, chiefly due to higher client assets and increased transactional activity.

headline: Ameriprise: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Ameriprise Financial Services Inc. AMP) on Thursday reported first-quarter net income of $583 million. The Minneapolis-based company said it had net income of $5.83 per share.
